bracket.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one of the pair of signs ( ) put around words to show extra information
bracket.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Last year’s sales figures are given in brackets.
bracket.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a piece of metal, wood, or plastic, often in the shape of the letter L, fixed to a wall to support something such as a shelf
bracket.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to consider two or more people or things as being similar or the same
bracket.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Women and minors were bracketed together for the legislation.
Arizona has been bracketed with Iowa in the tournament.
bracket.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to put brackets around a written word, piece of information etc
bracket.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a particular range that an amount or number, such as someone’s income or age, falls into
bracket.translation[2].definitions[1].de: one of the ranges of amounts that people’s income is divided into for the purpose of deciding how much tax they should pay
bracket.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: a rate of 35% in the top bracket (=for people with the highest incomes)
